cards.name: Sakuttomon
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When you play another Digimon with [Legend-Arms] in its traits by an effect, gain 1 memory.
ruling: Q: If 2 or more of my Digimon with [Legend-Arms] in its traits are played at the same time, does this card's inherited effect gain 1 memory for each Digimon that was played?
A: No, even if two or more Digimon with [Legend-Arms] in its traits are played at the same time with one effect, this card's inherited effect will only gain 1 memory.
Q: If there are Digimon with this card in their digivolution cards. If a Digimon with [Legend-Arms] in its traits is played. Will each inherited effect be activated and gain a total of 2 memory?
A: Yes, in that case, the total memory from both effects will be 2 memory.

cards.name: Zubamon
cards.effect1: [On Play] By placing this Digimon under 1 of your other Digimon that's black or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits as its bottom digivolution card, you may reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a Digimon card with [Legend-Arms] in its traits and a play cost of 7 or less, you may play it without paying its memory cost. Add the rest to your hand.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] If you have a Digimon that's black or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits in play, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less.
ruling: Q: Is it possible to not activate the [On Play] effect of this card?

A: Yes, "By placing this Digimon under 1 of your other Digimon that's black or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits as its bottom digivolution card" is a cost, so you can choose not to place it as a digivolution card. If you do, you will not proceed the rest of the effect.

Q: If after revealing a Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits from the top of the deck. Is it possible to not play the Digimon card with this card's [On Play] effect?
A: Yes, it is optional to play the Digimon. If you do not play it, add it to your hand liek any other card.

Q: If my opponent has has [BT9-047 Pomumon] in play, what happens to a Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits that was revealed from the deck due to this card's [On Play] effect?
A: Since it cannot be played due to the effect of [BT9-047 Pomumon]'s [All Turns] effect, the card is add it to your hand in the same way as other revealed cards.

cards.name: ZubaEagermon
cards.effect1: [On Play] By placing this Digimon under 1 of your other Digimon that's black or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits as its bottom digivolution card, detele 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less.
cards.effect2: [When Attacking] If you have a Digimon that's black or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits in play, detele 1 of your opponent's Digimon with 3000 DP or less.
ruling: Q: Is it possible to not activate the [On Play] effect of this card?
A: Yes, "By placing this Digimon under 1 of your other Digimon" is a cost, so you can choose not to place it as a digivolution card. If you do, you will not delete a Digimon with this effect.

cards.name: Duramon
cards.effect1: [Your Turn] When this Digimon would digivolve into a card in your hand that's black or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits, reduce the digivolution cost by 1.
cards.effect2: [End of Your Turn] You may DNA digivolve this Digimon and one of your other Digimon in play into a Digimon card in your hand by paying its DNA digivolve cost.
ruling: Q: How does this card's [End of Your Turn] effect work?

A: At the end of your turn, the Digimon that has this card as a digivolution card and another Digimon, can be used to <DNA Digivolution> into a Digimon card that has <DNA Digivolution> in your hand before it becomes the opponent's turn.
Q: Can this card's inherited effect digivolve into a Digimon card that doesn't have <DNA Digivolution> in your hand?
A: No, you can't ignore digivolution conditions, so you can't DNA Digivolve into a Digimon card that doesn't have <DNA Digivolution>.
Q: Is it possible to evolve DNA Digivolve with a Digimon of a colour or level that is not specified in the <DNA Digivolution> conditions of the card in hand?
A: No, you can't ignore digivolution conditions, so it is not possible to evolve DNA DIgivolve with a Digimon of a colour or level not specified in the <DNA Digivolution> conditions.

cards.name: Durandamon
cards.effect1:
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn) When one of your effects places a digivolution card under this Digimon, this Digimon gets +3000 DP and gains <Security Attack +1> (This Digimon checks 1 additional security card) for the turn.
[When Attacking] Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. You may play 1 Digimon card with [Legend-Arms] in its traits and a play cost of 7 or less among them without paying its memory cost. Place the rest at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Your Turn] While this Digimon is [RagnaLoardmon], it doesn't activate [Security] effects on Option cards it checks.
ruling: Q: Is it possible to not play a revealed Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits from the deck with the [When Attacking] effect of this card?
A: Yes, it is "you may", so you can choose not to play the Digimon card. If you do, put it on the bottom of your deck like any other card.

Q: If my opponent has has [BT9-047 Pomumon] in play, what happens to a Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits that was revealed from the deck due to this card's [When Attacking] effect?
A: Since it cannot be played due to the effect of [BT9-047 Pomumon]'s [All Turns] effect, the card is add it to your hand in the same way as other revealed cards.

cards.name: RagnaLoardmon
cards.effect1:
[When Digivolving] <Blitz> (If your opponent has 1 or more memory, this Digimon may attack).
When  DNA digivolving, for every 4 cards in this Digimon's digivolution cards, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 20 or less and trash the top card of your opponent's security stack.
[All Turns] (Once Per Turn) When a card is removed from a player's security stack, unsuspend this Digimon.
ruling: Q: Can this card perform <Blitz> when performing a DNA Digivolution?
A: Yes, it works as long as the memory is 1 or more on the opponent's side.

Q: If this Digimon has 8 digivolution cards, does this card's [When Digivolving] effect after DNA Digivolving, delete 2 of my opponent's Digimon both with a play cost of 20 or less, and trash 2 cards from the top of my opponent's security?
A: Yes, that's right.

Q: When DNA Digivolving into this card and the memory was 1 or more on the other side, and it activates <Blitz>. If this Digimon has a [When Attacking] effect. Is it possible to activate the [When Attacking] effect before applying the rest of this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect?

A: No, <Blitz> and "for every 4 cards in this Digimon's digivolution cards, delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 20 or less and trash the top card of your opponent's security stack." are on effect. So if it was DNA Digivolved, you must finish activating the above effects, after declaring an attack with <Blitz>, the effects will continue activating. Afterwards, you can activate [When Attacking] effects.

cards.name: Chikurimon
cards.effect1: [All Turns] Players can't reduce play costs.
ruling: Q: What kind of effect is this card's "can't reduce play costs."?

A: It is an effect that nullifies "reduce memory cost by x". You and your opponent will be unable to activate effects that reduce play costs, and must pay the play cost written on the cards in order to play them.
Q: When this Digimon is in play, can "play without paying its memory cost" effects activate?
A: Yes, "play without paying its memory cost" is not an effect that reduces play costs, so it can activate.

cards.name: Ludomon
cards.effect1: [On Play] By placing this Digimon under 1 of your other Digimon that's red or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits as its bottom digivolution card, you may reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a Digimon card with [Legend-Arms] in its traits and a play cost of 7 or less, you may play it without paying its memory cost. Add the rest to your hand.
cards.effect2: [Opponent's Turn] While you have a Digimon that's red or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits in play, this Digimon gains <Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead).
ruling: Q: Is it possible to not activate the [On Play] effect of this card?

A: Yes, "By placing this Digimon under 1 of your other Digimon that's black or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits as its bottom digivolution card" is a cost, so you can choose not to place it as a digivolution card. If you do, you will not proceed the rest of the effect.

Q: If after revealing a Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits from the top of the deck. Is it possible to not play the Digimon card with this card's [On Play] effect?
A: Yes, it is optional to play the Digimon. If you do not play it, add it to your hand liek any other card.

Q: If my opponent has has [BT9-047 Pomumon] in play, what happens to a Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits that was revealed from the deck due to this card's [On Play] effect?
A: Since it cannot be played due to the effect of [BT9-047 Pomumon]'s [All Turns] effect, the card is add it to your hand in the same way as other revealed cards.

cards.name: TiaLudomon
cards.effect1: [On Play] By placing this Digimon under 1 of your other Digimon that's red or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits as its bottom digivolution card, 1 of your Digimon gains <Reboot> (Unsuspend this Digimon during your opponent's unsuspend phase) until the end of your opponent's next turn.
cards.effect2: [Opponent's Turn] While you have a Digimon that's red or has [Legend-Arms] in its traits in play, this Digimon gains <Blocker> (When an opponent's Digimon attacks, you may suspend this Digimon to force the opponent to attack it instead).
ruling: Q: Is it possible to not activate the [On Play] effect of this card?
A: Yes, "By placing this Digimon under 1 of your other Digimon" is a cost, so you can choose not to place it as a digivolution card. If you do, your Digimon will not gain <Reboot>.

cards.name: RaijiLudomon
cards.effect1: [Opponent's Turn] This Digimon can't be deleted by your opponent's effects.
cards.effect2: [End of Your Turn] You may DNA digivolve this Digimon and one of your other Digimon in play into a Digimon card in your hand by paying its DNA digivolve cost.
ruling: Q: How does this card's [End of Your Turn] effect work?

A: At the end of your turn, the Digimon that has this card as a digivolution card and another Digimon, can be used to <DNA Digivolution> into a Digimon card that has <DNA Digivolution> in your hand before it becomes the opponent's turn.
Q: Can this card's inherited effect digivolve into a Digimon card that doesn't have <DNA Digivolution> in your hand?
A: No, you can't ignore digivolution conditions, so you can't DNA Digivolve into a Digimon card that doesn't have <DNA Digivolution>.
Q: Is it possible to evolve DNA Digivolve with a Digimon of a colour or level that is not specified in the <DNA Digivolution> conditions of the card in hand?
A: No, you can't ignore digivolution conditions, so it is not possible to evolve DNA DIgivolve with a Digimon of a colour or level not specified in the <DNA Digivolution> conditions.
Q: What does "can't be deleted by your opponent's effects" on this card's [All Turns] effect refer to, exactly?

A: Card text that specifically specify "delete," such as "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon," can't be used to delete this Digimon. They can still be deleted by losing a battle or being reduced to 0 DP.

cards.name: BryweLudramon
cards.effect1:
[Your Turn] (Once Per Turn)  When one of your effects places a digivolution card under this Digimon, your opponent's effects can't delete this Digimon or return it to its owner's hand or deck until the end of your opponent's turn.
[When Digivolving] Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. You may play 1 Digimon card with [Legend-Arms] in its traits and a play cost of 7 or less among them without paying its memory cost. Place the rest at the bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Opponent's Turn] While this Digimon is [RagnaLoardmon], it isn't affected by the effects of your opponent's Digimon.
ruling: Q: Is it possible to not play a revealed Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits from the deck with the [When Digivolving] effect of this card?
A: Yes, it is "you may", so you can choose not to play the Digimon card. If you do, put it on the bottom of your deck like any other card.

Q: If my opponent has has [BT9-047 Pomumon] in play, what happens to a Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits that was revealed from the deck due to this card's [When Digivolving] effect?
A: Since it cannot be played due to the effect of [BT9-047 Pomumon]'s [All Turns] effect, the card is add it to your hand in the same way as other revealed cards.
Q: If the opponent has [BT9-112 DeathXmon], and it activates its [End of Opponent's Turn] effect. Will the Digimon with this card's inherited [Opponent's Turn] effect be deleted?

A: Yes, the timing of this card's inherited effect is [Opponent's Turn], and since the turn has not changed yet at the end of the turn, the inherited  effect of this card is not applied, and the effect of the opponent's [BT9-112 DeathXmon] will not be prevented.
Q: If this Digimon is underneath a suspended [RagnaLoardmon] and is targeted for the effect of [BT3-057 MegaGargomon], does this card unsuspend during the next unsuspend Phase?
A: No, even though the Digimon is unaffected by the effects they have been applied and during your unsuspend phase it is no longer unaffected by your opponent's Digimon effects.

cards.name: Direct Smasher
cards.jpname: ディレクトスマッシャー
cards.effect1:
While you have a Digimon with [Legend-Arms] in its traits in play, you may use this card without meeting its color requirements.
[Main] Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with the highest DP.
ruling: Q: Can this card's [Main] effect delete all of the opponent's Digimon with the highest DP?
A: No, only one Digimon can be deleted with this card. If there are multiple opponents with the highest DP, the player of this card selects the target to be deleted.

cards.name: Legend-Arms Alliance
cards.effect1:
[Main] You may play 1 Digimon card with [Legend-Arms] in its traits and a play cost of 7 or less in your hand without paying its memory cost. Then, place this card in your Battle Area.
[Main] <Delay> (Trash this card in your battle area to activate the effect below. You can't activate this effect the turn this card enters play.)
・Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Place those cards on the top or bottom of your deck in any order.
cards.effect2: [Security] You may play 1 Digimon card with [Legend-Arms] in its traits and a play cost of 7 or less in your hand without paying its memory cost. Then, place this card in your battle area.
ruling: Q: Can the [Main] effect be used when you don't have a Digimon card with a play cost of 7 or less and [Legend-Arms] in its traits in your hand, so that only the effect of placing this card in the battle area is applied?
A: Yes, it is possible.
Q: Is it possible to separately return the revealed cards to the top and bottom of the deck for this card's <Delay> effect?
A: No, you cannot. You must choose whether to return all revealed cards to the top of the deck in any order or all revealed cards to the bottom of the deck in any order.
